message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a novel loss function for improving the visual quality of pan-sharpened satellite images using deep learning methods. This involves training convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to align high-resolution panchromatic (PAN) and low-resolution multi-spectral (MS) images, which can be applied to various types of CNN structures. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category, which deals with image and video processing. Additionally, the paper addresses issues related to image alignment and artifact suppression, which are relevant to Graphics (cs.GR) and Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. The use of deep learning methods and loss functions also suggests that the paper may belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the application of the proposed method to satellite images suggests that the paper may also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category, which deals with the organization and retrieval of large datasets.
